TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit OidCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class implements the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the OidCollection class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.OidEnumerator> class implements the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> interface, which allows you to move within a collection.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.OidCollection> class.
[!code-cs[Cryptography.Oid#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/m-system.security.crypto_50_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Cryptography.Oid#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/m-system.security.crypto_50_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[Cryptography.Oid#1](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/m-system.security.crypto_50_1.cpp)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether access to the object is thread safe.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This collection is not thread safe.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.OidCollection> class.
[!code-cs[Cryptography.Oid#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/p-system.security.crypto_105_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Cryptography.Oid#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/p-system.security.crypto_105_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[Cryptography.Oid#1](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/p-system.security.crypto_105_1.cpp)]

Docs.param: The location of the object in the collection.
Docs.summary: Gets an object from the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to retrieve an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Oid> object from an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.OidCollection> object, if you know its location. You can use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.OidCollection.Item%2A> property to retrieve an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Oid> object if you know the value of the object's <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Oid.Value%2A> property or <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Oid.FriendlyName%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.OidCollection> class.
[!code-cs[Cryptography.Oid#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/p-system.security.crypto_46_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Cryptography.Oid#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/p-system.security.crypto_46_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[Cryptography.Oid#1](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/p-system.security.crypto_46_1.cpp)]

Docs.param: A string that represents a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Oid.Value%2A> property or a <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Oid.FriendlyName%2A> property.
Docs.summary: Gets the first object that contains a value of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Oid.Value%2A> property or a value of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Oid.FriendlyName%2A> property that matches the specified string value from the object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to retrieve an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Oid> object from an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.OidCollection> object if you know the value of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Oid.Value%2A> or <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Oid.FriendlyName%2A> property of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Oid> object. You can use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.OidCollection.Item%2A> property to retrieve an <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Oid> object if you know its location in the collection.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.OidCollection> class.
[!code-cs[Cryptography.Oid#1](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/p-system.security.crypto_87_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Cryptography.Oid#1](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/p-system.security.crypto_87_1.vb)] [!code-cpp[Cryptography.Oid#1](../../add/codesnippet/CPP/p-system.security.crypto_87_1.cpp)]

Docs.summary: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the object.
Docs.value: An object that can be used to synchronize access to the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.OidCollection> is not thread safe. Derived classes can provide their own synchronized version of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.OidCollection> class using this property. The synchronizing code must perform operations on the SyncRoot property of the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.OidCollection> object, not directly on the object itself. This ensures proper operation of collections that are derived from other objects. Specifically, it maintains proper synchronization with other threads that might simultaneously be modifying the <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.OidCollection> object.

Docs.returns: An object that can be used to synchronize access to the object.
